title: Create a Better Coffee Mug (Refined)
description: Model an ergonomic mug using revolve, shell, sweep, and fillets with guided animations and Fusion actions.

steps.title: Create Sketch on XZ Plane
steps.instruction: Create a new sketch on the XZ plane.
steps.detailedText: We build the outer silhouette first, then hollow it using Shell.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: Choosing the correct sketch plane ensures the revolve axis aligns properly with the mug centerline. This prevents misalignment errors and simplifies downstream modeling operations.

tips: Use the XZ plane so the Y-axis can be used as the revolve axis.
Using the wrong plane may cause revolve alignment issues later.

steps.title: Sketch Outer Mug Silhouette
steps.instruction: Draw the mug outer profile using Line + Arc: ~95mm tall, base radius ~34mm, rim radius ~38mm (slight flare).
steps.detailedText: Create a gentle taper and a smooth base transition for a realistic and stable mug.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: A tapered silhouette improves ergonomics and realism. Smooth transitions reduce geometry failures in Shell/Fillet later and keep the timeline robust.

tips: Add dimensions early to maintain proportions.
Keep the profile entirely on one side of the axis.

uiAnimations.text: Use Line to sketch the silhouette
Sketch on ONE side of the axis only

fusionActions.text: Draw a closed outer profile (one side of axis).

steps.title: Close Profile and Finish Sketch
steps.instruction: Close the profile back to the axis and click Finish Sketch.
steps.detailedText: You should see a shaded region inside the profile.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: A closed profile is required to generate a watertight revolve body. This prevents downstream failures when applying Shell and Fillets.

tips: A shaded region means the profile is closed correctly.
If it does not shade, look for tiny gaps or overlaps.

uiAnimations.text: Make sure the profile region is shaded

fusionActions.text: Confirm the profile is closed (shaded), then finish sketch.

steps.title: Revolve Outer Body
steps.instruction: Create > Revolve. Select the closed profile and revolve 360° around the Y-axis. Operation: New Body.
steps.detailedText: This produces a clean outer solid. We hollow it next using Shell so thickness stays editable.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: Revolve is the most stable way to create circular-symmetric objects. Revolving the outer form first simplifies later edits and avoids sketching both inner and outer walls.

tips: Axis must be on the edge of or outside your profile.
If the axis intersects the profile region, revolve may fail or create unexpected geometry.

fusionActions.text: Revolve profile 360° around Y-axis → New Body.

steps.title: Shell the Mug
steps.instruction: Modify > Shell. Select the top face and set thickness to 3mm.
steps.detailedText: Shell hollows the mug while keeping a uniform wall thickness that is realistic and print-friendly.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: Shell creates consistent wall thickness without requiring a second inner sketch profile. This improves editability and reduces sketch complexity, making the model more robust.

tips: Select the top opening face for Shell.
If Shell fails, try reducing thickness or simplifying the base.

qcChecks.text: Shell applied to create hollow interior

fusionActions.text: Shell the mug from the top face at 3mm thickness.

steps.title: Fillet the Rim
steps.instruction: Modify > Fillet. Select the top inner edge and top outer edge. Set radius to ~2mm.
steps.detailedText: A rounded rim improves comfort and looks more premium.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: Fillets improve ergonomics and reduce stress concentration. A rounded rim also avoids thin sharp edges that may chip or print poorly.

tips: Start with 1mm if 2mm fails, then increase gradually.
Select both inner and outer rim edges.

fusionActions.text: Fillet rim edges to improve comfort.

steps.title: Create Handle Path Sketch
steps.instruction: Create a sketch on the mug side plane and draw a 3-point arc for the handle path.
steps.detailedText: Place endpoints near the mug wall and arc outward for finger clearance (~30mm).

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: The handle path determines usability. Proper clearance prevents knuckle collision and ensures the handle is comfortable and functional.

tips: Aim for a smooth C-shape.
Do not intersect the mug body with the arc.

uiAnimations.text: Start a new sketch for the handle path
Use 3-point arc for the handle path

fusionActions.text: Draw a handle path arc with enough clearance for fingers.

steps.title: Create Handle Profile Sketch
steps.instruction: Create a profile (rounded rectangle/oval) about 11mm x 8mm at the handle path start.
steps.detailedText: The profile must be closed and centered so the sweep stays stable.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: A closed, centered profile prevents sweep twisting and ensures a clean join to the mug body. The size affects comfort and strength.

tips: Keep the profile centered on the path start point.
If the sweep twists, the profile plane may not be perpendicular.

uiAnimations.text: Place the profile at the path start

fusionActions.text: Draw a closed handle profile (about 11x8mm) and finish the sketch.

steps.title: Sweep the Handle (Join)
steps.instruction: Create > Sweep. Select the handle profile, then the arc path. Operation: Join.
steps.detailedText: This creates the handle and merges it into a single solid mug body.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: Sweep preserves a consistent cross-section along the curved path. Join ensures the handle becomes part of the mug for printing and structural integrity.

tips: Select the profile first, then the path.
If Join fails, ensure the handle ends touch the mug body.

fusionActions.text: Sweep profile along path and set operation to Join.

steps.title: Blend Handle Joints (Fillet)
steps.instruction: Apply fillets at the handle-to-body joints. Start at 3mm and increase if stable.
steps.detailedText: Blending strengthens the joint and makes the handle look integrated.

expandedContent.whyThisMatters: Filleting the handle joint reduces stress concentration and improves durability. It also improves aesthetics, making the handle look designed rather than attached.

tips: Apply a small fillet first, then increase gradually.
If fillet fails, select fewer edges at once.

fusionActions.text: Blend handle joints using Fillet for strength and realism.
